definition: omen/sign (that sth is about to happen)/warning sign

sentences.english: I sign the memorials with a point usually.
sentences.chinese: “朕平時批閱奏章，就是點個點”。

sentences.english: Such majestic demeanor as befits a nephew of mine.
sentences.chinese: 氣勢如虹，不愧是朕的侄兒。

sentences.english: It appears you are the emotional one, but am I offended?
sentences.chinese: 你現在好像也很衝動，得罪朕了麼？

sentences.english: I like convent but I wish they will not admit any women under the age of fifty.
sentences.chinese: 朕喜歡女修道院，其不至收容年齡五十以下之婦人。

sentences.english: I envy you for giving such a personable and astute son gifted in both cultural and military affairs.
sentences.chinese: 朕羨慕你，有這樣識大體明事理，且文武兼備的兒子。

sentences.english: Is it I that ruin the kingdom of Lordaeron?
sentences.chinese: 難道是朕將洛丹倫葬送的嗎？

sentences.english: What a talented artist, I feel so gratified.
sentences.chinese: 天才的藝術家，朕很欣慰。

sentences.english: Her Majesty, the Emperor. Do you know why I like this particular red?
sentences.chinese: 知道朕爲什麼喜歡茜素紅嗎？

sentences.english: These three mirrors I have always cherished.
sentences.chinese: 朕當常保此三鏡，以防己過。

sentences.english: I hereby proclaim the Empress coronation will take place on the fifteenth day of this month.
sentences.chinese: 傳朕口諭，本月十五，舉行皇后冊封大典。

sentences.english: For the past 18 years I have begged for your forgiveness.
sentences.chinese: 十八年來，朕一直在祈求上蒼的寬恕。

sentences.english: Yan Yan, you really make me dissatisfied.
sentences.chinese: 顏顏，你真的令朕很失望。

sentences.english: Then I shall swallow it and it will warm my heart.
Unlike my nephew your Crown Prince who only knows to sing and dance.
sentences.chinese: 不像朕的侄兒，也就是你們的太子，只會唱戲。

sentences.english: The exertion that that wench acts in pettish is severe, I also ordinarily can not sustain the blows.
sentences.chinese: 那丫頭撒嬌的功夫是厲害，朕也經常招架不住的。

sentences.english: If you have any regrets we can pardon him at once.
sentences.chinese: 皇后如後悔，朕現在就赦了他。

definition: I, me (self-referring by a widowed empress etc, used in historical novels and operas)
I (first person pronoun used by royalty or nobility)
courtier's or minister's form of address for the current Emperor
the emperor/Your majesty the emperor/His imperial majesty
state official or subject in dynastic China/I, your servant (used in addressing the sovereign)/Kangxi radical 131
(literary) I, your servant (self-appellation of a lower-rank female)/(archaic) male and female slaves/subjects (of a ruler)
I/me/my/(often used in early vernacular literature)
Taishang Huang/Retired Emperor/father of the reigning emperor/fig. puppet master
